bug.short_desc: [table] fire's no selection events when removing items

long_desc.thetext: When you remove a item from an table viewer the selection change event would not be fired.
When you remove a item from an table viewer the selection change event would not be fired.

The description is unclear to me. Please provide a self-contained snippet to clarify. What I tried is removing a selected item from an SWT Table (Windows). There is no selection event fired, hence RWT won't fire an event either.
Might this be a duplicate of bug #210257: [table] Removed rows in virtual tables can still be selected? https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=210257

Rüdiger, I think this is not a duplicate.
This bug here means, that a selection event should be fired when an item is removed.
For example, if the first item is selected and is removed, then the second item should become the first item and an selection event should be thrown. But currently no selection event is thrown, and in the selection there is still the first item (which was already removed).

Still, it is unclear to me what you are trying to achieve. Too many things unspecified (MULTI?, SINGLE?, VIRTUAL?, what code is used to remove item?, ...) As asked for in #2, could you provide a self-contained code snippet to reproduce the problem?

Made sure that the RAP Table/TableViewer aligns with the original JFace/SWT implementations in this respect. Calling either TableViewer#refresh() or TableViewer#setInput() after the model element was removed will clear the selection and send a SelectionChangeEvent

Sorry for opening this bug again... This issue can be reproduced very easy using the controls demo: - Open the TableViewer-Tab - Select the VIRTUAL-flag - Select first row - Press "remove selected rows" button --> The selection label on the right still says, the deleted row is selected.
See attached screenshot for details.
Created attachment 97951 Screenshot shows that the selection label still contains the text of the removed table element.

Created attachment 100896 Standalone TableViewerTab, ported to RCP JFace/SWT
This class shows that JFace/RAP behaves the same as JFace/RCP
FJace/RCP shows the same behavior, see comment #10.

attachment.desc: Screenshot shows that the selection label still contains the text of the removed table element.
Standalone TableViewerTab, ported to RCP JFace/SWT
